pull.title: build: use Clang 15 for macOS cross-compilation
pull.body: This will end up being a blocker for #28210, and is already part of #21778, even though an even newer LLVM/Clang combination is required (and still missing from upstream Guix). Seems straight-forward enough to just bump the macOS compiler to a more modern Clang.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.

| ---- | --------- |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#27897](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27897) (guix: use GCC 12.3.0 to build releases by fanquake)
* [#27099](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27099) (build: produce a .zip for macOS distribution by fanquake)
* [#25573](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25573) ([POC] guix: produce a fully `-static-pie` bitcoind by fanquake)
* [#25391](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25391) (guix: Use LTO to build releases by fanquake)
* [#21778](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21778) (build: LLD based macOS toolchain by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Does it need any additional changes? E.g. https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21778#issuecomment-1474952915 ? 

And I presume the additional cleanups require llvm 16? E.g. "[build: remove cctools and libtapi packages](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21778/commits/dbfadba592272f60085f11a235cf49a539a7b175)" or [guix: use GUIX_LD_WRAPPER_DISABLE_RPATH for all HOSTS](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21778/commits/6796983485b89926e8f91eb0252706ef27ee067c) or [build: drop bind_at_load usage on macOS](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21778/commits/2bd560d08edb246199c2afd031caba470be44627)

> Does it need any additional changes? E.g. #21778 (comment) ?

No additional changes needed. I think that comment is outdated in any case.

> And I presume the additional cleanups require llvm 16? E.g.

Yea. The switchover to lld requires LLVM 16+, which we still need to package and/or upstream into Guix.

issue.title: guix: use GCC 12.3.0 to build releases
issue.body:
Switch to using [GCC `12.3.0`](https://gcc.gnu.org/gcc-12/) to build release binaries.

Update the vmov-alignment patch, for changes in GCC 12.
Retain GCC 10 for macOS builds, to avoid build failures in native tools, due to the combination of old Clang, and new libstdcxx.

Guix Build:
```bash
TBD
```

issue.title: build: produce a .zip for macOS distribution
issue.body:
Reviving the discussion around using a `.zip` for the distributed macOS binaries, as opposed to a `.dmg`.

Given we only had a single report of the "no finder window" issue (#26176), I wonder if that means macOS users were able to figure it out, they gave up/didn't report, or, we just have very few macOS users.

Related to #18128.

issue.title: [POC] guix: produce a fully `-static-pie` bitcoind
issue.body:
Use Guix to produce a fully `-static-pie` `x86_64-linux-gnu` & `aarch64-linux-gnu` bitcoind using GCC 12.3.0 and glibc 2.38. The binary is ~15mb stripped, includes wallet/upnp/natpmp/zmq etc, and is built using LTO. This builds on #25391 and #27897.

```bash
# file bitcoind
	ELF 64-bit LSB pie executable, x86-64, version 1 (GNU/Linux), static-pie linked, for GNU/Linux 3.2.0, stripped

# ldd bitcoind
	statically linked

# ls -la bitcoind
	14831792 bitcoind
```

Using glibc for static builds, would be less of a leap compared to switching to musl libc (POC in #23203).

So far I've tested the binary, including `test_bitcoin`, on a few different systems:
* Ubuntu 22.04 with glibc 2.35 (latest glibc release)
* Ubuntu 18.04 with glibc 2.27
* Ubuntu 16.04 with glibc 2.24
* CentOS 7 with glibc 2.17 (which is lower than our current minimum required of 2.18)
* CentOS 8 with glibc 2.28
* Alpine 3.16 with musl libc 1.2.3 (latest musl libc release)
* Alpine 3.12 with musl libc 1.1.24

I've also performed a full sync to the current tip (height=744166), and had the node running for a few days:

[`-static-pie`](https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc/Link-Options.html)
> Produce a static position independent executable on targets that support it.
A static position independent executable is similar to a static executable,
but can be loaded at any address without a dynamic linker.

issue.title: guix: Use LTO to build releases
issue.body:
Changes required to get LTO working for release (Guix) builds.

Based on #27897.

TODO:
- Windows Qt build doesn't work well under LTO. See related commit for details.

issue.title: build: LLD based macOS toolchain
issue.body:
This switches us to using a [LLD](https://lld.llvm.org/) based toolchain for macOS builds. Much work has recently been done on a [new Mach-O backend](https://reviews.llvm.org/rG03f43b3aca3) for LLD and as of LLVM 13 it has become [the default backend](https://reviews.llvm.org/D95204). 

### Benefits
* Less complicated macOS toolchain.
* No longer beholden to Apple releasing it's [source](https://opensource.apple.com/source/) for [cctools](https://opensource.apple.com/source/cctools/), [ld64](https://opensource.apple.com/source/ld64/) & [libtapi](https://opensource.apple.com/source/tapi/).
* No more reliance on third parties to modify those sources for us. i.e [apple-libtapi](https://github.com/tpoechtrager/apple-libtapi), [cctools-port](https://github.com/tpoechtrager/cctools-port) (cctools + ld64).

Based on #28337.

TODO:
- Requires LLVM 16 in Guix for [`fixup_chains`](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/commit/0d30e92f59589de44a185c53671b7fe2e83cd2ae) support.

fa0fcb35f3d6c886dfc7af0e036fb1942650fca0:

> There is no x86_64 binaries for 15.0.7.

https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/releases/download/llvmorg-15.0.7/clang+llvm-15.0.7-x86_64-apple-darwin21.0.tar.xz ?
Those binaries are built for Darwin.
